page.title: 01General Review
page.content: The area lies on Permian Limestone and Marl;it is rural in character and traversed by only the main roads.There are four main sections:_ 1.the western suburbs of the mining settlements of Shirebrook and Langwith Junction.This is largely composed of semi_detached council houses,some now in poor condition. 2.The small, attractive settlements of Scarcliffe and Stony Houghton,home of farmworkers,woodmen and gamekeepers amongst others 3.Arable farmland,featuring cereals (especially barley),potatoes and oilseed rape.The farms are generally large and prosperous. 4.Roseland and Langwith Woods,where the hardwoods were recently felled to be replaced by Corsican Pines.The woods are used for pheasant shooting and provide pleasant walks..
